meanings.definition: Layers of rock or sediment that alternate with each other.
meanings.sent1: The geologist studied the interbeds to understand the rock formations better.
meanings.sent2: The interbeds in the canyon showed a history of changing environments.
meanings.sent3: The interbeds played hide-and-seek with the different layers of earth.
meanings.sent4: The interbeds were like a sandwich of different types of rocks.
meanings.sent5: The interbeds resembled a colorful stack of blankets in the ground.

meanings.definition: To be situated between layers of rock or sediment.
meanings.sent1: The new layer interbeds between the existing ones, creating a unique pattern.
meanings.sent2: Water can interbeds with the soil, affecting its composition.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to interbeds itself between the cushions of the couch.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts interbeds with memories, creating a complex emotional landscape.
meanings.sent5: The music interbeds with the sounds of nature, creating a harmonious blend.
